intro: Kielmeyera variabilis subsp. paranaensis, commonly known as the Parana rubber tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to the Brazilian Atlantic Forest. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that can reach heights of up to 20 meters. The plant is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves that are arranged alternately along the branches. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by orange-yellow fruits containing several seeds. This species is valued for its latex, which has been used in traditional medicine and industry.
